title: NFL on Sling: Hereâ€™s How to Watch the Patriots vs. Chargers Wild Card GameÂ Online
summary: The Sunday night playoff game kicks off at 8:15 p.m. EST.
body: All products and services featured are independently chosen by editors. However, Billboard may receive a commission on orders placed through its retail links, and the retailer may receive certain auditable data for accounting purposes. To conclude NFL Wild Card Weekend , the Los Angeles Chargers are heading to Foxborough to face the New England Patriots. Led by potential MVP Drake May, the Pats saw an unbelievable turnaround this season, going 14-3, winning the AFC East title and obtaining the No. 2 seed in the conference. For the Chargers, this is their second-straight season with 11 wins under Jim Harbaugh. With their division rivals, the Kansas City Chiefs, finally out of their way, can Justin Herbert lead LA to the Suer Bowl? Here’s how to tune into to the Patriots vs. Chargers wild card game. When Does the Patriots vs. Chargers Game Start ? Patriots vs. Chargers game will kickoff on Jan. 11 at 8:15 p.m. ET/5:30 p.m. PT at Gillette Stadium in Foxborough, MA. Where to Watch Patriots vs. Chargers Online The NFL Wild Card game will broadcast live on NBC but can be streamed through Sling Blue . Keep scrolling on how to sign up for the streaming service. Here’s How to Wâ€¦

title: Andrea Bocelli to Perform at 2026 Olympics Opening Ceremony, Joining Mariah Carey as aÂ Headliner
summary: The opening ceremony takes place at San Siro soccer stadium in Milan, Italy, on Feb. 6.
body: Crossover tenor Andrea Bocelli will be among the headline performers for the Milan Cortina Winter Olympics opening ceremony on Feb. 6, joining the previously announced pop diva Mariah Carey , organizers announced on Sunday (Jan. 11). Related Mariah Carey Reveals She’s Performing at the 2026 Olympics Opening Ceremony: ‘Ci Vediamo a Milano!’ Iman Honors David Bowie on 10th Anniversary of His Death Bob Weir Remembered by Andy Cohen, Don Felder & More After His Death at 78 The 2026 Olympics opening ceremony will be centered in Milanâ€™s landmark San Siro soccer stadium, featuring the Parade of Athletes and entertainment over the course of the three-hour spectacle that is expected to be the most widely viewed moment of the Games. Reflecting the Milan Cortina Gamesâ€™ status as the most spread-out Olympics in history, elements of the opening ceremony will also be conducted in three other locations, allowing athletes from all far-flung disciplines to participate. Moments will be beamed to the televised audience from Cortina in the heart of the Dolomite mountains, Livigno in the Italian Alps, as well as Predazzo in the autonomous province of Trento. The ceâ€¦

title: Dave Matthews Blasts Trump Administration and ICE After Minnesota Shooting: â€˜These Are DarkÂ Timesâ€™
summary: The singer-songwriterâ€™s lengthy video comes after the fatal shooting of Renee Good on Jan. 7.
body: Dave Matthews is taking aim at the Trump administration in a fiery message following the fatal shooting of Renee Good in Minneapolis. The 59-year-old Rock & Roll Hall of Fame inductee shared a lengthy Instagram video on Friday (Jan. 9), criticizing President Donald Trump and Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) after Good was killed by an ICE officer earlier in the week. Related Duran Duran Pays Tribute to Renee Good After Fatal ICE Shooting in Minnesota DHS Slams Billie Eilish’s ‘Garbage Rhetoric’ About ICE After Singer Shares Posts Criticizing Minneapolis Shooting John Mulaney Postpones Minneapolis Shows Following ICE Killing of Renee Nicole Good: ‘What’s Happening in Your City Is Heartbreaking’ â€œI donâ€™t want my taxes to pay for ICE, to masked thugs to roam our streets and terrorize our communities and rip families apart,â€ Matthews said while walking through his neighborhood on his birthday. â€œWe should be taking care of each other. We should be minding each other. We should be housing the homeless. We shouldnâ€™t be, you know, throwing people to the ground.â€ The clip comes after the Wednesday (Jan. 7) death of 37-year-old Goodâ€¦

However, Billboard may receive a commission on orders placed through its retail links, and the retailer may receive certain auditable data for accounting purposes. The Philadelphia Eagles are taking on the San Francisco 49ers in a must-see NFL Wild Card game matchup. Kicking off at Lincoln Financial Field in Philly, the Birds aim to become back-to-back Super Bowl champs while the niners are fighting for their third finals appearance since 2020. Eagles vs. 49ers game, at a Glance: Date: Sunday, Jan. 11, 2026 Time: 4:30 p.m. ET TV channels: Fox Streaming: DirecTV , Fubo, Sling TV, Hulu + Live TV Will the defending Super Bowl champs make it back to the big game? With a star-studded cast of athletes, including Jalen Hurts, Saquon Barkley and A.J. Brown, you can never count out the Eagles. On the flipside, San Francisco’s big three: Brock Purdy, Christian McCaffrey and George Kittle will give Philly’s defense plenty of problems all game. We expect a shoutout at Lincoln Field today. Want to watch the NFL Wild Card game live? Below is a quick guide on the best ways to watch Philadelphia vs. San Francisco â€¦

title: Morgan Wallen, Garth Brooks, Taylor Swift & More Artists With Most Weeks at No. 1 on Top Country Albums Chart: FullÂ List
summary: Male solo artists dominate, though three female solo artists and two groups have also achieved the feat.
body: Morgan Wallen â€™s I’m the Problem leads Billboard ‘s Top Country Albums chart (dated Jan. 17) for the 34th consecutive week. This ups Wallen’s career tally of weeks at No. 1 to 220, allowing him to extend his lead as the artist with the most weeks at No. 1 in the chart’s 62-year history. Wallenâ€™s achievement is especially impressive because he has amassed this hefty total of weeks at No. 1 in such a short amount of time. He first topped the chart on Aug. 15, 2020. Top Country Albums originated as Hot Country Albums in the Jan. 11, 1964 issue of Billboard . Johnny Cash â€™s Ring of Fire (The Best of Johnny Cash) headed the inaugural chart. The compilation was well-timed: â€œRing of Fireâ€ had headed Hot Country Songs for seven weeks the previous summer and had crossed over to reach the top 20 on the Billboard Hot 100. The chart was named Hot Country LPâ€™s from 1968 to 1984, when vinyl LPs were king. Twenty-one artists have logged 50 or more weeks at No. 1 on Top Country Albums. Male solo artists dominate, as you might expect, though three female solo artists have achieved the feat, as have two groups. (One of those groups is an all-female group.) Only one Black artâ€¦

title: Welbeck scores as Brighton knock Man Utd out of FA Cup
summary: Striker Danny Welbeck helps Brighton dump his former club Manchester United out of the FA Cup at Old Trafford.

title: Taylor Swift, The Beatles, Elvis & More Artists With the Most Weeks at No. 1 on the Billboard 200: FullÂ List
summary: Swift is the top solo artist on the list, and the top American artist.
body: By returning to No. 1 on the Billboard 200 (dated Jan. 17) for a 13th nonconsecutive week with Iâ€™m the Problem, Morgan Wallen ups his career total of weeks at No. 1 on that chart to 42. That tally is topped by only seven acts in history â€” and by only three male solo artists: Elvis Presley , Garth Brooks and Michael Jackson . Wallen, 32, is the youngest artist on our list of artists who have logged 30 or more weeks at No. 1 on the Billboard 200. Taylor Swift , who he bumped from the No. 1 spot this week, is 36. A few quick notes: While Presley’s feats on the Billboard Hot 100 are shortchanged by the fact that his breakthrough in 1956 pre-dated the launch of Billboard â€™s flagship songs chart by more than two years, the Billboard 200 captures Presleyâ€™s entire career. His debut album, Elvis Presley , entered the chart at No. 11 in the issue dated March 31, 1956 â€” which was the chartâ€™s second week. If you count the  Saturday Night Fever  soundtrack (which logged 24 weeks at No. 1 in 1978) as a  Bee Gees  album, the trio had 31 weeks on top. Bee Gees had six tracks on the album â€” five of which were No. 1 hits on the Hot 100. But  Billboard  counts it â€¦

title: Morgan Wallenâ€™s â€˜Iâ€™m the Problemâ€™ Rebounds for 13th Week at No. 1 on BillboardÂ 200
summary: Plus, Olivia Deanâ€™s The Art of Loving reaches the top three for the first time.
body: For the first time in four months, Morgan Wallen â€™s Iâ€™m the Problem is back at No. 1 on the Billboard 200 albums chart, as the set climbs 2-1 on the list dated Jan. 17. The set collects its 13th nonconsecutive week atop the list, and its first since the Aug. 30, 2025-dated chart. The album debuted at No. 1 on the May 31, 2025, chart and spent 12 nonconsecutive weeks in the lead beginning with its debut frame. Related Taylor Swift, The Beatles, Elvis & More Artists With the Most Weeks at No. 1 on the Billboard 200: Full List Iman Honors David Bowie on 10th Anniversary of His Death Bob Weir Remembered by Andy Cohen, Don Felder & More After His Death at 78 Iâ€™m the Problem earned 85,000 equivalent album units in the United States in the week ending Jan. 8, according to Luminate, with the bulk of that sum driven by streaming activity of its songs. Meanwhile, Olivia Dean â€™s The Art of Loving continues to scale to new heights on the Billboard 200, hitting a new peak as it rises 4-3. It also posts new plateaus on the Top Album Sales and Top Streaming Albums charts. The Billboard 200 chart ranks the most popular albums of the week in the U.S. based on multi-metric consumption â€¦

title: â€˜Wicked: For Goodâ€™ Nears $525 Million in Worldwide Grosses: Full List of Top-Grossing Film Adaptations of BroadwayÂ Musicals
summary: The smash sequel is just the third adaptation of a Broadway musical to top the $500 million mark.
body: Wicked: For Good has grossed $522.3 million worldwide in its first eight weeks at the boxoffice, which puts it at No. 3 on Billboard â€™s list of the top-grossing films that are adapted from Broadway musicals. Our list is drawn from boxofficemojo.comâ€™s running tally of the 1,000 top-grossing films of all time in terms of worldwide grosses. Both Wicked: for Good and its predecessor, 2024â€™s Wicked , were adapted from the 2003 Broadway musical Wicked . The first Wicked film opened on Nov. 22, 2024. In just five weeks, it pulled ahead of Mamma Mia! to become the top-grossing film adapted from a Broadway musical. Wicked received 10 Oscar nominations on Jan. 23, 2025, including nods for both of its stars, Cynthia Erivo and Ariana Grande . It won two awards at the Oscars ceremony on March 2, 2025 â€” best costume design and best production design. Nominations for the 2026 Oscars will be announced on Thursday Jan. 22. Both Wicked and Wicked: For Good were directed by Jon M. Chu, whose hit-studded rÃ©sumÃ© includes a previous film adaptation of a Broadway musical, the 2021 movie version of Lin-Manuel Miranda â€™s breakout hit In the Heights . Eight film adaptations of Broadway musicals appear on Bâ€¦

title: Goals, shocks and fan power on a record-breaking FA Cup weekend

title: Sargent made himself unavailable for Norwich cup win - Clement
summary: Philippe Clement says Josh Sargent will not be leaving Norwich in January, after claiming the striker made himself unavailable for Sunday's FA Cup tie with Walsall.

title: Magic Makama hat-trick as Norwich beat Walsall
summary: Twenty-one-year-old Jovon Makama scores a hat-trick as Norwich City beat Walsall in the FA Cup third round.

title: Two for Reed as Mansfield upset Sheff Utd in thriller
summary: Mansfield Town cause one of the shocks of the FA Cup third round with a stunning victory over Sheffield United in a seven-goal thriller at Bramall Lane.

title: Own goal gives Spurs narrow home win over Leicester
summary: Signe Gaupset impresses on her Women's Super League debut as Tottenham defeat Leicester City to boost their push for a Champions League place.

title: Chelsea kick off new year by thrashing West Ham
summary: Chelsea begin the new year with an impressive victory over West Ham in visiting manager Rita Guarino's first match in the Women's Super League.

title: Arsenal beat Portsmouth thanks to Martinelli hat-trick
summary: Gabriel Martinelli scores the first hat-trick of his senior career as an Arsenal side showing 10 changes come from a goal down to beat Championship side Portsmouth 4-1 in the FA Cup third round.

title: Man City beat Everton at home to strengthen grip on WSL title
summary: Manchester City consolidate their place at the top of the Women's Super League table with a convincing win over Everton.

title: Substitute Gordon, 43, produces save of season to keep Hearts beating
summary: Craig Gordon, 43 years young, having not played since Scotland's World Cup qualification heroics over Denmark, produces the save of the season to earn Hearts victory.

title: 'Big personality' Martinelli goes from 'idiot' to hat-trick hero
summary: Gabriel Martinelli was branded an "idiot" a few days ago - but showed great personality to respond with an FA Cup hat-trick, according to Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta.

title: Maestre wants London City players to match his ambition
summary: Eder Maestre challenges London City Lionesses players to match his ambition after his managerial tenure with the Women's Super League club begins with a drab goalless draw against Liverpool.

title: Bordeaux thump Northampton in Champions Cup repeat
summary: Prem leaders Northampton are handed a European lesson by Champions Cup holders Bordeaux in a repeat of last year's final.

title: Liverpool remain bottom after goalless home draw to London City Lionesses
summary: Bottom club Liverpool remain without a win in the Women's Super League after being held to a drab goalless draw by London City Lionesses.

title: Are 'efficient' Chelsea ready to chase down titles?
summary: Having won the last six Women's Super League titles, Chelsea have not had to chase for a while. But they are up for the challenge this time.

title: Connacht let slip 17 point lead in Montpellier
summary: Montpellier score three tries in the final 15 minutes to claim a thrilling 33-31 victory over Connacht in Pool One in the Challenge Cup.

title: Leeds avoid upset with second-half comeback against Derby
summary: James Justin scored his first goal for Leeds United since joining from Leicester City in the summer, in a second-half comeback after Derby County took the lead thanks to a Ben Brereton Diaz strike.

title: Ospreys lose to Zebre but secure Europe knockout spot
summary: Ospreys qualify for the Challenge Cup knockout stages despite a 23-19 defeat to Zebre.

title: Poland beat Switzerland for debut United Cup title
summary: Poland battle back to beat Switzerland 2-1 in the United Cup final in Sydney to win the mixed-gender tournament for the first time.

title: Clovers go third in hard-fought win over Thunder
summary: Clovers climbed to third in the Celtic Challenge after a hard-fought win over Brython Thunder at the Cardiff Arms Park.

title: 'I legged it' - Macclesfield chairman joined pitch invasion
summary: Macclesfield chairman Rob Smethurst says he feels like his side "won the FA Cup" with Saturday's third-round win over holders Crystal Palace.

title: Liverpool's Bradley out for season with knee injury
summary: Liverpool defender Conor Bradley is ruled out for the rest of the domestic season after suffering a significant knee injury, involving damage to bone and ligament.

title: McColgan reclaims European 10km record in Valencia
summary: Briton Eilish McColgan reclaims her women's European 10km record in Valencia in a time of 30 minutes seven seconds.

title: 'What a catch!' - Rams avoid play-off upset with 38 seconds remaining
summary: Colby Parkinson scores a touchdown with 38 seconds remaining as the Los Angeles Rams leave it late to beat the Carolina Panthers 34-31 to avoid a play-off upset.

title: Sabalenka beats Kostyuk to win third Brisbane title
summary: World number one Aryna Sabalenka prepares for the Australian Open with a 6-4 6-3 victory over Marta Kostyuk to win a third Brisbane International title.

title: Briton Smith stuns Matias to become world champion
summary: Britain's Dalton Smith shocks champion Subriel Matias with a fifth-round stoppage to claim the WBC light-welterweight title in New York.

title: Which players could England turn to for 2027 Ashes?
summary: BBC Sport looks at the players who may force their way into England contention before the 2027 Ashes series.

title: Rosenior wins first game as Chelsea thrash Charlton
summary: Liam Rosenior begins his reign as Chelsea head coach by overseeing a dominant display that saw off Championship side Charlton in the FA Cup third round.

title: Another door closes for Spurs and Frank with damaging FA Cup exit
summary: After Spurs' damaging FA Cup exit at home to Aston Villa, chief football writer Phil McNulty asks how long can head coach Thomas Frank survive?

title: 'He just nails it every time' - Emery's tactics too good for Tottenham
summary: Former FA Cup winners Danny Murphy and Micah Richards praise the work manager Unai Emery is doing at Aston Villa and analyse the tactics behind Villa's first goal in their 2-1 win against Tottenham in the FA Cup third round.

title: NASA Marshall Removes 2 Historic Test Stands
summary: NASAâ€™s Marshall Space Flight Center in Huntsville, Alabama, removed two of its historic test stands â€“ the Propulsion and Structural Test Facility and the Dynamic Test Facility â€“ with carefully coordinated implosions on Jan. 10, 2026. The demolition of these historic structures is part of a larger pâ€¦
body: To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video NASAâ€™s Marshall Space Flight Center in Huntsville, Alabama, removed two of its historic test stands â€“ the Propulsion and Structural Test Facility and the Dynamic Test Facility â€“ with carefully coordinated implosions on Jan. 10, 2026. The demolition of these historic structures is part of a larger project at Marshall that began in spring 2022, targeting several inactive structures and building a dynamic, interconnected campus ready for the next era of space exploration. Crews began demolition in December 2025 at the Neutral Buoyancy Simulator . Learn more about these iconic facilities. Credits: NASA

title: Frank's failing Spurs knocked out of FA Cup by Aston Villa
summary: Goals from Emiliano Buendia and Morgan Rogers knock a wasteful Tottenham Hotspur side out of the FA Cup to pile more pressure on manager Thomas Frank.

title: Newcastle win on penalties after epic six-goal thriller
summary: Newcastle United and Bournemouth play out a six-goal thriller, after a Harvey Barnes goal in the 118th minute is cancelled out by Marcus Tavernier's equaliser minutes later, with Newcastle progressing on penalties.

title: 'Crisp, concise, clinical' - Rogers doubles Villa's lead at Tottenham
summary: Morgan Rogers doubles Aston Villa's lead at Tottenham in their FA Cup third round match as the pressure increases on Spurs manager Thomas Frank.

title: 'Humble' Semenyo steals show in FA Cup mauling
summary: Antoine Semenyo signed off at Bournemouth in fairytale fashion and makes start to life at Manchester City in a similarly dreamy manner during 10-1 FA Cup win over League One Exeter City.

title: Stunning late Cisse strike sees Stoke beat Coventry
summary: Lamine Cisse's wonder goal two minutes from time sees Stoke City snatch victory against Championship rivals Coventry City and move into round four of the FA Cup.

title: Is Macclesfield beating Crystal Palace greatest FA Cup upset?
summary: After Macclesfield beat FA Cup holders Crystal Palace in the third round, BBC Sport looks at 10 of the biggest upsets in the competition's history.

title: 'It's double figures' - Manchester City score 10 as they thrash Exeter
summary: Seven-time winners Manchester City cruise into the fourth round of the FA Cup by thrashing League One side Exeter City 10-1, with new signing Antoine Semenyo scoring a debut goal at Etihad Stadium.

title: Final Steps Underway for NASAâ€™s First Crewed Artemis Moon Mission
summary: As NASA moves closer to launch of the Artemis II test flight, the agency soon will roll its SLS (Space Launch System) rocket and Orion spacecraft to the launch pad for the first time at the agencyâ€™s Kennedy Space Center in Florida to begin final integration, testing, and launch rehearsals. NASA is â€¦
body: NASAâ€™s SLS (Space Launch System) rocket is seen inside High Bay 3 of the Vehicle Assembly Building as teams await the arrival of Artemis II crewmembers to board their Orion spacecraft on top of the rocket as part of the Artemis II countdown demonstration test, Saturday, Dec. 20, 2025, at NASAâ€™s Kennedy Space Center in Florida. NASA/Joel Kowsky As NASA moves closer to launch of the Artemis II test flight, the agency soon will roll its SLS (Space Launch System) rocket and Orion spacecraft to the launch pad for the first time at the agencyâ€™s Kennedy Space Center in Florida to begin final integration, testing, and launch rehearsals. NASA is targeting no earlier than Saturday, Jan. 17, to begin the multi-hour trek from the Vehicle Assembly Building to Launch Pad 39B. The four-mile journey on the crawler-transporter-2 will take up to 12 hours. Teams are working around the clock to close out all tasks ahead of rollout. However, this target date is subject to change if additional time is needed for technical preparations or weather. â€œ We are moving closer to Artemis II, with rollout just around the corner,â€ said Lori Glaze, acting associate administrator for NASAâ€™s Exploration Systems Devâ€¦

title: Shaken, Not Stirred: NASAâ€™s StarBurst Aces Extreme Temperature Tests
summary: Heated, cooled, shaken, and settled â€“ NASAâ€™s StarBurst instrument is several steps closer to being ready for launch. The small satellite is now awaiting instrument calibration following a successful integration in Canada and rigorous testing by engineers at the agencyâ€™s Marshall Space Flight Centerâ€¦
body: NASAâ€™s StarBurst instrument outside a thermal vacuum chamber at NASAâ€™s Marshall Space Flight Center in Huntsville, Alabama. NASA/Daniel Kocevski Heated, cooled, shaken, and settled â€“ NASA’s StarBurst instrument is several steps closer to being ready for launch. The small satellite is now awaiting instrument calibration following a successful integration in Canada and rigorous testing by engineers at the agencyâ€™s Marshall Space Flight Center in Huntsville, Alabama. StarBurst is designed to detect the initial emission of short gamma-ray bursts, some of the most powerful explosions in the universe and a key indicator of neutron star mergers. This would provide valuable insight into such events, which are also detected through gravitational waves by observatories on Earth. These events are where most of the heavy metals in the universe, such as gold and platinum, are formed. To date, only one such event has been observed simultaneously in gravitational waves and gamma-rays; StarBurst is expected to find up to 10 per year. StarBurst arrived at NASA Marshall in March 2025. During its time at the center, the instrument underwent thermal testing in a vacuum chamber and flight vibratâ€¦

title: Flight Engineers Give NASAâ€™s Dragonfly Lift
summary: In sending a car-sized rotorcraft to explore Saturnâ€™s moon Titan, NASAâ€™s Dragonfly mission will undertake an unprecedented voyage of scientific discovery. And the work to ensure that this first-of-its-kind project can fulfill its ambitious exploration vision is underway in some of the nationâ€™s mostâ€¦
body: In sending a car-sized rotorcraft to explore Saturnâ€™s moon Titan, NASAâ€™s Dragonfly mission will undertake an unprecedented voyage of scientific discovery. And the work to ensure that this first-of-its-kind project can fulfill its ambitious exploration vision is underway in some of the nationâ€™s most advanced space simulation and testing laboratories. From left, Johns Hopkins APL engineers Tyler Radomsky and Felipe Ruiz install a rotor on the Dragonfly test model at the Transonic Dynamics Tunnel at NASAâ€™s Langley Research Center in Virginia. NASA Set for launch in in 2028, the Dragonfly rotorcraft is being designed and built at the Johns Hopkins Applied Physics Laboratory (APL) in Laurel, Maryland, with contributions from organizations around the world. On arrival in 2034, Dragonfly will exploit Titan’s dense atmosphere and low gravity to fly to dozens of locations, exploring varied environments from organic equatorial dunes to an impact crater where liquid water and complex organic materials essential to life (at least as we know it) may have existed together. Aerodynamic testing When full rotorcraft integration and testing begins in February, the team will tap into a trove oâ€¦

summary: As booster manager for NASAâ€™s SLS (Space Launch System), Dave Reynoldsâ€™ path to NASA is embodied by his childhood poster of the space shuttleâ€™s Return to Flight initiative, which hangs in his office, serving as a constant reminder that his journey to the agency began decades ago. Growing up in Roy,â€¦
body: 3 Min Read I Am Artemis: Dave Reynolds Dave Reynolds, the booster manager for SLS (Space Launch System), works inside the Next Generation Booster Avionics Mockup at NASAâ€™s Marshall Space Flight Center in Huntsville, Alabama. Reynolds is responsible for the design, development, and flight of the boosters for the rocket that carry NASAâ€™s Orion spacecraft and astronauts to the Moon as part of the Artemis II mission. Credits: NASA As booster manager for NASAâ€™s SLS (Space Launch System), Dave Reynoldsâ€™ path to NASA is embodied by his childhood poster of the space shuttleâ€™s Return to Flight initiative, which hangs in his office, serving as a constant reminder that his journey to the agency began decades ago. Growing up in Roy, Utah, Reynolds remembers standing outside to watch the billowing smoke rise from booster tests at Northrop Grummanâ€™s Promontory facility. Rockets were the backdrop of his childhood, and growing up during the shuttle missions sparked his fascination for space exploration. As the booster manager for the SLS, Dave is responsible for the design, development, and flight of the boostersâ€”work that echoes the sense of significance that inspired him as a child to study spaâ€¦

A new NASA spacecraft called Pandora is awaiting launch ahead of its journey to study the atmospheres of exoplanets, or worlds beyond our solâ€¦
body: 6 min read NASAâ€™s Pandora Satellite, CubeSats to Explore Exoplanets, Beyond Editorâ€™s Note, Jan. 11, 2026: NASAâ€™s Pandora and the NASA-sponsored BlackCAT and SPARCS missions lifted off at 8:44 a.m. EST (5:44 a.m. PST) Sunday, Jan. 11. A new NASA spacecraft called Pandora is awaiting launch ahead of its journey to study the atmospheres of exoplanets, or worlds beyond our solar system, and their stars. Along for the ride are two shoebox-sized satellites called BlackCAT (Black Hole Coded Aperture Telescope) and SPARCS (Star-Planet Activity Research CubeSat) , as NASA innovates with ambitious science missions that take low-cost, creative approaches to answering questions like, â€œHow does the universe work?â€ and â€œAre we alone?â€ All three missions are set to launch Jan. 11 on a SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket from Space Launch Complex 4 East at Vandenberg Space Force Base in California. The launch window opens at 8:19 a.m. EST (5:19 a.m. PST). SpaceX will livestream the event. Artistâ€™s concept of NASAâ€™s Pandora mission, which will help scientists untangle the signals from the atmospheres of exoplanets â€” worlds beyond our solar system â€” and their stars. title: Ganges Delta Under a Winter Shroud of Fog
summary: Low clouds blanketed the delta while parallel cloud bands rolled over the Bay of Bengal during a January cold wave.
body: Earth Observatory Science Earth Observatory Ganges Delta Under a Winterâ€¦ Earth Earth Observatory Image of the Day EO Explorer Topics All Topics Atmosphere Land Heat & Radiation Life on Earth Human Dimensions Natural Events Oceans Remote Sensing Technology Snow & Ice Water More Content Search Collections Global Maps World of Change Articles Notes from the Field Blog Earth Matters Blog Blue Marble: Next Generation EO Kids Mission: Biomes About About Us Subscribe ğŸ›œ RSS Contact Us January 6, 2026 Winter weather took hold across the Indo-Gangetic Plain in early January 2026, bringing dense fog and cold temperatures to much of the flat, fertile lands that span from Pakistan and northern India to Bangladesh. This image shows low-lying clouds over the delta on the morning of January 6, captured by the MODIS (Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer) on NASAâ€™s Terra satellite. Dense fog, particularly radiation fog , is common this time of year, forming when ground temperatures are cool, winds are light, and moisture is abundant near the surface. The meteorological departments of both Bangladesh and India called for moderate to very dense fog over the region that day amid anâ€¦

title: NASA to Provide Media with International Space Station Update Today
summary: NASA will host a live news conference at 5 p.m. EST on Thursday from the agencyâ€™s headquarters in Washington to discuss the International Space Station and its crew. On Jan. 7, the agency announced it was postponing a planned spacewalk originally scheduled for Jan. 8 while teams monitored a medicalâ€¦
body: Credit: NASA NASA will host a live news conference at 5 p.m. EST on Thursday from the agencyâ€™s headquarters in Washington to discuss the International Space Station and its crew. On Jan. 7, the agency announced it was postponing a planned spacewalk originally scheduled for Jan. 8 while teams monitored a medical concern with a crew member currently living and working aboard the orbital laboratory. The matter involved a single crew member, who is stable . Due to medical privacy, it is not appropriate for NASA to share more details about the crew member. Participants in the news conference include: NASA Administrator Jared Isaacman Amit Kshatriya, associate administrator Dr. James Polk, chief health and medical officer, NASA Headquarters NASA will provide live coverage of the news conference on NASA+ , Amazon Prime , and the agencyâ€™s YouTube channel . Learn how to stream NASA content through a variety of online platforms, including social media. To participate in the news conference virtually or in-person, media must RSVP for details no later than one hour before the start of the event to the NASA Newsroom at: hq-media@mail.nasa.gov . NASAâ€™s media credentialing policy is online. To lâ€¦

title: NASA Starts Up Gatewayâ€™s Power System for First Time
summary: Development continues on NASAâ€™s Power and Propulsion Element, a solar electric propulsion spacecraft designed to provide power for Gateway in lunar orbit. Able to generate 60 kilowatts of power, the element was successfully powered on earlier last year. The milestone demonstrates the element can prâ€¦
body: 1 min read Preparations for Next Moonwalk Simulations Underway (and Underwater) The primary structure of Gatewayâ€™s Power and Propulsion Element (PPE) undergoing assembly, integration, and testing at Lanteris Space Systems in Palo Alto, California, on September 29, 2025. Lanteris Space Systems Development continues on NASAâ€™s Power and Propulsion Element, a solar electric propulsion spacecraft designed to provide power for Gateway in lunar orbit. Able to generate 60 kilowatts of power, the element was successfully powered on earlier last year. The milestone demonstrates the element can provide the spacecraft with power, high-rate communications, attitude control, as well as the ability to maintain and maneuver between orbits. The Power and Propulsion Element is managed by NASAâ€™s Glenn Research Center in Cleveland and built by industry partner Lanteris Space Systems in Palo Alto, California, where teams have secured the elementâ€™s main electrical system inside protective exterior panels. On deck for installation at Lanteris Space Systems are three 12-kilowatt advanced electric propulsion system thrusters, manufactured by L3Harris, and four 6-kilowatt Busek-built BHT-6000 thrusters. title: The man behind the headlines - Salah, by Klopp, Diaz and more
summary: BBC Sport explores Mohamed Salah's personality with help from the people who know him best.

title: Inside McLaren's season - the rules, values, incidents & relationships
summary: Intra-team title battles turn toxic far more often than not. Andrew Benson analyses how McLaren have maintained relative harmony between Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri.

title: England's AI World Cup masterplan - from perfecting penalties to powering players
summary: BBC Sport hears from inside the England setup about how artificial intelligence is powering plans for next summer's World Cup.

title: 'Raise hell' - the fastest bowler you might not have heard of
summary: The story of Duncan Spencer, the "frighteningly fast" bowler who could have played for England or Australia.
